sentences.english: It may be possible to cut personnel costs by shifting some active-duty troops to the reserves temporarily, she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說，可能會通過將現役軍人轉爲預備役來削減兵員。

sentences.english: The reversals of the last several months have led our military to ask for 206,000 more troops.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾個月的退卻迫使軍方要求增加二十萬六千兵員。

sentences.english: Nepoleon from think the soldier is ample, there is Shi have no perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 拿破崙自以爲兵員充足，有恃無恐。

sentences.english: The naval ship is equipment and platform for campaigning of bluejacket and the weight of naval ship is an important factor for campaigning property.
sentences.chinese: 艦船是武器裝備和兵員在水上或水下的運動作戰平臺。

sentences.english: If Darius has put his faith in numbers, Alexander will rely on strategy.
sentences.chinese: 大流士義兵員衆多爲優勢，亞歷山大則憑戰略取勝。

definition: using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
